intro: Bertolonia leuzeana, commonly known as the Cape York daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats, such as grasslands and rocky areas, and is adapted to dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, providing some drought tolerance. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by insects.
